content: @pnkfelix @nikomatsakis for the release this thursday, we ended up backporting a LLVM change as well to fully fix https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/69225 - someone came up with a reproduction that the revert bugfix didn't work anymore. We never approved that in compiler meetings though, but I think we should approve this change. I'm not sure what process to follow here, but we do have artifacts both with and without the fix, and can release either technically

(nikic approved said LLVM change, and it's quite minimal -- https://github.com/rust-lang/llvm-project/compare/2cb41005ed5c4747b10d2bf01d8779d3bb4ae32d...7d5e7c023053660ffe494d72ce471e48ecc7f49b#diff-5a6e7b948274577e7852f0d53de949d0)
yes, the default plan is to proceed with the LLVM backport commits
I'm fine with the LLVM backport commits, based on the discussion thread on #69225
